SENT.plain: Congenital mesoblastic nephroma (CMN) is a rare primary pediatric renal tumor occurring predominantly in infants
There is no known association between CMN and WT1 gene expression and the association of hemihypertrophy and CMN is not well known
We report an infant with isolated hemihypertrophy and WT1-positive CMN, and the results of WT1 immunostaining in 13 other patients with CMN diagnosed over 14 years at SickKids
Of the 14 total patients 3 had positive nuclear immunostaining for WT1
Two patients also expressed WT1 RNA by reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction
In conclusion, contrary to previous reports, WT1 may be expressed in CMN and CMN can be associated with hemihypertrophy in the absence of Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome
